captions.text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today we are gonna be making something that
has been heavily requested for

such a long time! We are gonna be making a
Volcano Cake! A science cake!

And we’re gonna be using dry ice today,
so that when we make the volcano, actual

smoke will be coming out of the top. I’m
so excited to do this!

Plus my little friends, they’re finally
gonna have a little home!
Yes!
Alright, let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: Pretzel
sticks, frosting, I have vanilla

buttercream and chocolate frosting. 1 water
bottle, and what I did on the top

of this as you can see, I cut off the top
of the water bottle, because this will

be the tube for our volcano which we put
the dry ice in. You’ll also need graham

crackers, cherry jello mix, 1 12 inch chocolate
cake, you can use any recipe

you’d like, and you’ll need 4 6 inch chocolate
cakes. I used this pan, little

6 inch round pan. And last but not least you
will need dry ice, you keep dry ice in

a cooler, not in the freezer like you would
think, that’s what I thought.

But no, you keep it in a cooler, and here
it is. Oh! It’s kinda sch-moky!

It’s gonna get super smoky when we add liquid
to it.

When it reacts with H2O. Alright! Let’s
put this all together!

The first thing you’re gonna do is
take your 4 6 inch round cakes and your

water bottle, and I’m putting this water
bottle in the middle. It can be any

shape or size, doesn’t matter, or it can
be a plastic cup! That’s fine too!

And I’m just gonna cut out the shape like
so!
Haha that’s kinda creepy, I’ll stop now!

Once you got all the centers cut out of the
4 cakes, what you’re gonna do is

frost them in-between, stack them, and then
put the water bottle
right down the middle.

Now you’re gonna put on a little muffin
cake top, eragh! Like so!

Perfect, alright, now you’re gonna put this
huge monster of cake pile into the
freezer and freeze for about 20 minutes.

While the volcano cake is in the freezer,
we’re gonna go do a bunch of other things.
Prep baking!

OK, so the first thing that I did is you’re
gonna take graham crackers, just a

basic graham cracker, and I threw these in
the blender, if you don’t have a blender

you can hand crumble them so that they will
look like this. Kind of makes them

look like sand. I did this when I made the
Game of Thrones cake.
The chest of the dragon eggs!

Then you’re gonna take green fondant, and
if you don’t have fondant you can use

leaf candy, or any other sticky gummy candy,
kinda like airheads or whatever

you got. Some Tootsie Rolls candy comes in
different colors, I got this little

mold at Michaels, it’s from Wilton, I’ve
used it a bunch, it’s really really handy,

and I’m using the smallest leaf that I could
find, and I’m just pressing the fondant

in there and then you’re just gonna cut
out the shape of the leaf with a little

knife or a toothpick or whatever you’ve
got handy.

And what we’re gonna end up doing, is taking
a pretzel stick, which is going to

be the tree trunk. And then we’re
gonna put all the little

fondant leaves up on the top. Then stick them
all together up here.

Alright, we just took the cake out of the
freezer, and now you’re

gonna take your sharpest knives and we’re just
gonna start carving the shape
of the volcano!

Just finished carving my volcano shape, and
now I’m gonna take this, it’s basically

like a big flipper, and we’re gonna stick
it under our volcano cake, pick it up,

and then transfer it onto our big round circle
12 inch cake.
OK here we go, hooo!
Got it!

Easy does it! Easy does it! Easy does it!
Easy does it!
YES!

I’m positioning the volcano towards the
back of the cake so that theres a little

bit of room in the front because I’m gonna
make my little trees there, and other

stuff. Perfect! Now we’re just gonna frost
a bunch of chocolate frosting
all up the volcano!

And now I am going to frost the sand, to make,
on the bottom, on the base of the

cake, because I’m gonna make this look like
Volcano Island! It’s like

Jurassic Park, only, the whole thing’s a
volcano!

I’m just gonna spread the sand colored frosting
all along the base of the cake.

And then I’m gonna sprinkle on our graham
cracker crumbs to make it look
like real sand!

I just finished putting all the graham cracker
on to make it look like a beach on

Volcano Island, and now I’ve got blue frosting,
it’s actually 2-toned,

I put a little bit of light blue and a little
bit of dark blue, and green frosting.

And I’m gonna make the ocean for Volcano
Island, and then I’m gonna put little
grass everywhere!

The last decoration that I made last night
was this little teeny dino!

I just had to, he was so cute! My dinos were
too big to fit on this Volcano Island,
so I made this little guy out of fondant!

I’m just gonna stick him right here, oh
he’s so cute!
Oh yeah, he’s just hanging out. Perfect!
And now it’s time for dry ice!

So here is the test experiment, here is us
using dry ice, and the Jello

water mixture I made, and it’s making all
these weird, uh, gas filled pockets, and

I think it’s because the sugar wasn’t
completely dissolved, and I think that if

you do use Jello, you are gonna have to boil
2 cups of water and then add the mixture

to make sure that the sugar has completely
dissolved, because if you don’t, this
is what’s going to happen!

So instead, I’m just going to be adding
water, gonna make it easy, because

the smoke is what we want. And I thought it
would be bubbling a little bit
of red, but instead, this is happening!

I am so excited, this is the part that I’ve
been looking forward to!

I just carefully put in a bunch of dry ice,
into the water bottle, through the top.

Just be very careful when you’re handling
dry ice, you want to gloves, and I like

to use tongs or pliers, just do not touch
the dry ice because it is -109 degrees,

so it’s very, very cold, it reminds me of
liquid nitrogen!

OK, I’ve got the water, remember, we’re
not using Jello because it did that weird
effect that I don’t know what that was.

I’m just gonna pour water, very carefully,
here we go!
Into Volcano Island!
Oh it's amazing!
Oh-ho-ho-ho-ho-ho-ho-ho!
Oh Dino, don't get too close to the Volcano!

I’m gonna add a little bit more, because
it’s just so cool!
Wha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha!

Oh my gosh this is so cool! Thanks you guys
for suggesting it, I had so much fun

making this cake, because it had to do with
science!

So if you guys have any other suggestions
for any other Nerdy Nummies, please

let me know, leave me a comment down below
and I will do my best to make it happen!
OK, bye-bye!

Why don’t I do this for every single drink
that I drink?
Just like, oh, yes!
Agh, pfft, pfft!
Maybe that’s why!
